Posted By: mlanier131 (5/20/2011 12:45:19 PM)

posts.post_content:
Used with Land Tax in the deck Parfait! (It's a mono white control deck). It's like casting an Ancestral Recall each turn.  
  
One trick with it: If you don't have any cards in your library and you're about to draw on your draw step, simply activate the Rack, and put a card back into your library! You'll never get milled again!
posts.html:
Used with Land Tax in the deck Parfait! (It's a mono white control deck). It's like casting an Ancestral Recall each turn.

One trick with it: If you don't have any cards in your library and you're about to draw on your draw step, simply activate the Rack, and put a card back into your library! You'll never get milled again!

Posted By: Mutt_Monster (7/24/2009 10:53:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's good, no doubt about that. I think this should be an easy card 'fix' (IE, Strip Mine -> Ghost Quarter, Tectonic Edge)
  
   
   
Archive Vault 2
  
   
Legendary Artifact- Rare
  
   
2, T: Choose up to four cards in your hand and exile them. Put an equal number of cards from on top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and return to the bottom of your library in any order.
  
   
"For every scroll retrieved from the Vault, another must be put in its place. Historians shed light on the past, and enshroud the events of daylight in mystery. The pendulums swing and the circles rotates, then the Great Door is locked for another 1,000 years."
  
   
Yes, the From the Vault reference is indeed deliberate. :)
  
   
Pendulums and Circles double reference complicating locking mechanism on the Vault's artwork and the progression of new set releases and old sets' retirement.
  
   
Changes:
  
Doubled Activation cost
  
Send to Bottom instead of Top
  
Limit to four cards instead of entire hand.
  
   
N... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: ChaosFire (2/6/2011 12:33:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@thaviel  
  
That is called card quality advantage, and it is a big part of magic. It is why Brainstorm and [Goblin Recruiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Recruiter) are so good. Brainstorm uses 1 card and only lets you draw 1 card, but it is so good because you get to pick which card it is from the top three cards of your library.
posts.html:
@thaviel

That is called card quality advantage, and it is a big part of magic. It is why Brainstorm and Goblin Recruiter are so good. Brainstorm uses 1 card and only lets you draw 1 card, but it is so good because you get to pick which card it is from the top three cards of your library.
